content:
𝐖𝐞 𝐚𝐫𝐞 #𝐡𝐢𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐃𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐩𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐒𝐩𝐞𝐜𝐢𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐬𝐭!

Apakah kamu menyukai industri keuangan syariah dan ingin mengembangkan bisnis ALAMI? 
Kenali bagaimana menjadi seorang Business Development Specialist ALAMI dan apa saja kriteria yang kami cari.

Bismillah, semoga dapat membantu kamu mengenali lebih jauh bagaimana Business Development Specialist di ALAMI dan mungkin kamu yang kami cari.

Kirim CV terbaru beserta dokumen pendukung ke recruitment@alamisharia.co.id dengan 𝗦𝘂𝗯𝗷𝗲𝗰𝘁 : 𝗣𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘀𝗶 𝘆𝗮𝗻𝗴 𝗗𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗺𝗮𝗿 - 𝗡𝗮𝗺𝗮 𝗣𝗲𝗹𝗮𝗺𝗮𝗿.

Mari mengembangkan dunia keuangan syariah Indonesia dengan memberikan manfaat lebih banyak untuk kesejahteraan Indonesia dan dunia.

#ALAMISisiTerbaikmu #HijraKeALAMI #HijrahFinansial #recruitment #BusinessDevelopmentSpecialist #businessdevelopment

author: Tobi Oluwole
author_info: Merchant Success @ Shopify | Helping people transition into their dream roles with 3Skills
content:
Job Description: This is an entry level role

Candidate: Perfect. I’ll apply 

Job Description: No not you. We’re looking for someone with 3 years of experience. 

Candidate: But that’s not entry level. 

Job description: It is! We’re paying $38,000 a year

Candidate: I think I’ll pass!

“Years of experience” should be irrelevant for entry level roles. 

Hire for character and train for skill. 

Also, $38,000 for a full-time role (especially for someone with 3 years of experience) is exploitation. 

If you’re looking for great entry level roles that are remote, look for:

- Sales Development Rep
- Business Development Rep
- Implementation Specialist 
- Onboarding Specialist 
- Customer Success Associate 

And make sure you get paid what you’re worth.

The #NAJC works closely with its partners in the National Association of Catholic Chaplains, the Association for Clinical Pastoral Education, the Association of Professional Chaplains and the Canadian Association for Spiritual Care and is a member of the Network of Jewish Human Service Agencies (NJHSA). #NuvanceHealth

author: Bucks County Herald
content:
Gabarelly's Stockton Steaks is partnering with Fisherman's Mark, a local community social services agency, for a delicious fundraiser that supports the community in the Hunterdon County area.

“Cheesesteaks for Those in Need” kicks off Wednesday, Feb. 2, which happens to be Groundhog Day.

When customers buy cheesesteaks at the Stockton eatery, they can purchase additional ones for $10 apiece, which will in turn be donated to those in need in the community. Each cheesesteak purchased will generate a complimentary cheesesteak coupon that will be given to Fisherman’s Mark, and the agency will distribute the vouchers to its clients.

Find out more: https://lnkd.in/ecdVjk8a

author: Canadian Blood Services
content:
Introducing one of our newest board members: David Morhart from British Columbia.  
 
Currently working as a senior executive with the British Columbia Investment Management Corporation, a majority of David’s career was spent in senior leadership roles within the provinces of British Columbia and Alberta. His provincial government career culminated in him serving as deputy minister for a variety of portfolios between 2010 and 2019. 
 
His time spent as CEO of the B.C. Ambulance Service, deputy minister of human, community, social services and deputy minister of innovation and advanced education have provided him with insight into the health system provincially and across Canada. David’s expertise in health innovation acquired from his time on the Genome Alberta and National Institute of Nanotechnology boards will also bring value to his position on the Canadian Blood Services board of directors.  
 
Watch to hear how David hopes to inform the next four years in his role on the Canadian Blood Services board.  
 
To meet David Morhart, click here: https://lnkd.in/d-7ZQgvj

***
Appointed by the provincial and territorial ministers of health (except Quebec), the board of directors comprises 13 members. Each director serves for a term of four years. 

In December 2021, two directors and our board chair completed their time on the Canadian Blood Services board. We thank them for their commitment, guidance and leadership.

author: Merlyn Horton
content:
Positive Reframing is a technique where instead of pathologizing others for their behaviours, we seek to look deeper and see the positive payoff in the behaviour. Highly effective with all ages, studies have shown looking at personality traits in a new way can lead to new behaviours. Learn more at The Foundations of BC Housing Practices Workshop
Dates: Jan. 31 and Feb. 7, 
Time: 10 am-1 pm
Cost: $29.95 (for eligible B.C. Professionals)
Deadline to register is Jan. 24 
https://lnkd.in/g9BWFZsA #house #housing #bcsocialservices

author: City of Prince George
content:
Help ensure that Prince George is a safe, vibrant, and livable community for all residents and visitors! Join the Bylaw Services team assigned to the downtown core; your main focus will be to proactively respond to concerns related to public safety and cleanliness. You'll also perform wellness checks with vulnerable populations, working with downtown outreach workers, and provide referrals to community social services.

In this dynamic role, you'll ensure the security of City facilities and parkades, receive and investigate bylaw complaints, communicate and educate others on bylaw requirements, and take action to achieve compliance when violations have occurred. 

Read on about this career opportunity and how you can positively help and educate residents in Prince George: https://bit.ly/3Iw2W15 

Interested? Apply by January 31.

#princegeorgebc #downtownpg #bylawservices #communitysupport #outreachsupport

author: Marina Dawson
content:
I absolutely love affordable professional development! Check out this great list of webinars and workshops being hosted by The Federation of Community Social Services of BC via the Community Social Services Training Fund. Topics include:

* Reconciliation for nonprofits
* Engaging volunteers during and post-COVID
* Culturally welcoming & inclusive volunteer programs
* Foundations of BC Housing Practices for the Frontlines
* HR Recruitment & Dealing with Turnover
* Financial Literacy

The sessions are hosted in partnership with organizations such as Volunteer BC, Safer Online, and Sincron HR Software and are subsidized via the training fund. I don't think any of the programming costs more than about $30 to attend, so this is a great value!

author: Stefan Thomas
author_info: Helping Students Find Their Path & Purpose 🎓 | Student Affairs Professional 📚 | Public Speaker🎙 | LinkedIn Content Creator & Motivator 🧑🏽💻
content:
I’VE FINALLY GRADUATED UNIVERSITY 🎓 

Can I start by saying, GOD IS SO GOOD! After 4 hard years of grinding, I’m proud to say that I graduated from University of Guelph-Humber with a 3.7 GPA (90% cumulative average). 

Ever since I was in high school, I’ve always been one to work extremely hard. Although I achieved many things throughout my undergrad, I’ve always tried my best to use each achievement as an opportunity to inspire other students around me and show them that with a little dedication and a strong work ethic, anything you want is possible.

I’m grateful for everyone who has supported and believed in me throughout this journey! This isn’t the end, but it’s simply the beginning of something great. I’m super excited for the next chapter of my life and for pursuing what will be a fulfilling career in higher education; while pursuing my dreams as a motivational speaker on the side!

Here’s a brief list of some of my accomplishments over the last 4 years:

🔸Graduated with Distinction 
🔹BASc in Family and Community Social Services
🔸Diploma in SSW 
🔹Board of Directors for IGNITE
🔸Student Ambassador (aka START Leader) for UoGH
🔹3 Scholarships
🔸3 Field practicums (850 hours of field experience)
🔹Paid off OSAP in FULL (screams for joy!)

#collegesanduniversities #students #graduation #graduates #university #leadership #blackexcellence #education #highereducation #career #socialwork #success #motivation #inspiration #Toronto #Ontario #Canada #GHgrad #Classof2021

author: Toronto Society of Architects
content:
Next Tuesday, January 25 at 12:00 noon EST join us for our second FREE virtual event as part of the DesignTO Festival with a series of fast-paced pecha-kucha style presentation (20 slides for 20 second seconds each) exploring diverse perspectives, ideas and strategies on confronting the housing crisis. From housing equity to modular housing initiatives, rent-then-own models to community support and consultation, you will not want to miss this IDEAS Forum: Confronting the Housing Crisis.

Come hear from an amazing lineup of speakers including:

* Kellie Chin, Architect at WORKSHOP and co-author of "The Case for Compassionate Design in Housing Standards"
* Diana Chan McNally, Community Worker and Educator, Toronto Drop-In Network (TDIN)
* Reverend Faith Fowler, Executive Director Cass Community Social Services
* Daniel Ling, Director and Principal at Montgomery Sisam Architects
* Eric Philip, Director of Real Estate and Property Management at Dixon Hall

This event is being organized in partnership with DesignTO and is FREE and open to everyone! Make sure to save your spot by RSVPing in the link below.

https://lnkd.in/dhthf2SN
#housing #housingequity #housingcrisis #TorontoSocietyofArchitects Ontario Association of Architects

author: Gauri Shankar
content:
Hello Friends

author: Kieran Earnshaw
content: Really excited to have re-joined PwC as a Partner in Financial Services Consulting after 11 years away from the Firm. Already feels like being back home and I couldn't be more motivated to get going!
